intro: Cyanothamnus penicillatus, commonly known as the slender blue bush, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant features narrow, blue-green leaves and produces small, blue or purple flowers in dense clusters. It is typically found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Cyanothamnus penicillatus is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
